current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To establish a State Trade and Export Promotion Grant Program.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

text.#text: In making grants under this subsection, the
focuses on eligible small business concerns as part of an export promotion program;

socially and economically disadvantaged small business concerns;
small business concerns owned or controlled by women; and
rural small business concerns;

text.#text: The

A State desiring a grant under the program shall submit an application at such time, in such
			 manner, and accompanied by such information as the
A State desiring a grant under the program shall—

before submitting an application under clause (i), consult with applicable trade agencies of the
			 Federal Government on the scope and mission of the activities the State
			 proposes to carry out using the grant, to ensure proper coordination and
			 reduce duplication in services; and

document the consultation conducted under subclause (I) in the application submitted under clause
			 (i).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall award grants under the program on a competitive basis.

text.#text: The

The Federal share of the cost of an export program carried out using a grant under the program
			 shall be—
for a State that has a high export volume, as determined by the
for a State that does not have a high export volume, as determined by the

The non-Federal share of the cost of an export program carried out using a grant under the program
			 shall be comprised of not less than 50 percent cash and not more than 50
			 percent of indirect costs and in-kind contributions, except that no such
			 costs or contributions may be derived from funds from any other Federal
			 program.

text.#text: The

			 activities being performed with each grant;

the effect of each grant on exports by eligible small business concerns in the State receiving the
			 grant;
the total return on investment for each State; and

a description of best practices by States that showed high returns on investment and significant
			 progress in helping more eligible small business concerns to export.

text.#text: The TPCC shall also include 1 or more members  appointed by the
A member appointed under subparagraph (A) shall be appointed for a term of 2 years.
A member of the TPCC appointed under subparagraph (A) shall serve without compensation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

text.#text:
A member of the TPCC appointed under subparagraph (A) shall be allowed travel expenses, including

			 agencies under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or the head of another agency, as appropriate, shall make available to a

			 reasonably require to carry out services for the TPCC.
